description: Unlock advanced styling with pseudo-classes like hover and pseudo-elements like before and after.

slides.title: What are they?
slides.content:
# Pseudo-classes vs Elements üé≠

## Pseudo-class (:)
A keyword added to a selector that specifies a special **state** of the selected element(s).
- Example: `:hover` (when mouse is over it)

## Pseudo-element (::)
A keyword added to a selector that lets you style a specific **part** of the selected element(s).
- Example: `::first-line` (the first line of text)

# Summary üé≠

Pseudo-selectors give you surgical precision.

## Key Takeaways

- ‚úÖ **:hover, :active, :focus** handle user interaction.
- ‚úÖ **:first-child, :nth-child** handle structure.
- ‚úÖ **::before, ::after** insert decorative content.
- ‚úÖ **::selection** customizes highlighting.
